text: hi welcome to our video series on
enabling chatbox chat bots can help
provide a way for students to ask
questions and get access to their
institution's answers in this video we
will show you how easily you can deploy
a QA chat bot we will execute an AWS
CloudFormation template to set up the
infrastructure for the chat environment
a CloudFormation template provides a
common language to describe and
provision all the infrastructure
resources in your AWS cloud environment
this AWS CloudFormation template will
set up resources such as Amazon Lex
Amazon Elastic search service Amazon API
gateway and AWS lambda let's get started
you will need an AWS account to start
with if you do not have one you can
easily create a new account by going to
AWS amazon.com
after successfully signing into your AWS
account select the AWS region you would
like to deploy the solution to in this
video we will use US East Northern
Virginia region from the AWS console
navigate to services and select cloud
formation from the list of services you
will be presented with the AWS
CloudFormation create stack console
click on the create stack button from
the Amazon s3 template URL copy and
paste the URL from the guide click Next
and enter the information such as stack
name and email address the email address
will be used to send you a URL and
temporary password to access the Q&A
chat environment click on create stack
to deploy the solution while the
solution is being deployed you will see
the cloud formation stack status as
create in progress the solution will
take approximately 30 to 45 minutes to
deploy once the AWS CloudFormation
template has finished the steps to build
out the queue a chatbot the status of
the stack will have the status of create
complete you should also have received
an email with the temporary password and
the URL link to access the queue a
chatbot environment in our next video
we'll take a closer look at the QA chat
bought designer and client experiences
see you in the next video
